bug.author: yuanqing-wang
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
When I tried to build DGL from source, I get this error: <denchmark-code> Scanning dependencies of target dmlc Scanning dependencies of target metis [ 0%] Building CXX object third_party/dmlc-core/CMakeFiles/dmlc.dir/src/config.cc.o [ 1%] Building CXX object third_party/dmlc-core/CMakeFiles/dmlc.dir/src/data.cc.o [ 1%] Building CXX object /data/chodera/wangyq/jax-dgl/dgl/third_party/dmlc-core/include/dmlc/base.h:124:71: note: #pragma message: Will need g++-5.0 or higher to compile allthe features in dmlc-core, compile without c++11, some features may be disabled "compile without c++11, some features may be disabled") ^ [ 1%] Building C object third_party/METIS/libmetis/CMakeFiles/metis.dir/__/GKlib/b64.c.o In file included from /data/chodera/wangyq/jax-dgl/dgl/third_party/dmlc-core/src/data.cc:2:0: /data/chodera/wangyq/jax-dgl/dgl/third_party/dmlc-core/include/dmlc/base.h:124:71: note: #pragma message: Will need g++-5.0 or higher to compile allthe features in dmlc-core, compile without c++11, some features may be disabled "compile without c++11, some features may be disabled") ^ [ 2%] Building C object higher to compile allthe features in dmlc-core, compile without c++11, some features may be disabled "compile without c++11, some features may be disabled") ^ In file included from reader, any *data); ^ /data/chodera/wangyq/jax-dgl/dgl/third_party/dmlc-core/include/dmlc/./././json.h:573:45: error: ‚Äòany‚Äô does not name a type void (*write)(JSONWriter* reader, const any& data); reader, const any& data); ^ /data/chodera/wangyq/jax-dgl/dgl/third_party/dmlc-core/include/dmlc/./././json.h:579:3: error: ‚Äòunordered_map‚Äô in namespace ‚Äòstd‚Äô does not name a type ‚Äòtp‚Äô std::type_index tp = std::type_index(typeid(T)); ^ /data/chodera/wangyq/jax-dgl/dgl/third_party/dmlc-core/include/dmlc/./././json.h:537:9: error: ‚Äòtype_name_‚Äô was not declared in this comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yuanqing-wang>@yuanqing-wang</denchmark-link> , have you updated submodules? git submodule update --init --recursive
Yes. And the result didn't change.
How about you rerun cmake and build the project again? btw, what's your gcc/g++ version?
GCC8.3 gives the same error. Any suggestions about the GCC version to use?
Hi, I cannot reproduce your error with GCC 9. Did you change any flag in the CMakeLists.txt?

I am using this commit-id: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dmlc/dgl/commit/ba3966027e373b64992f921ae7c66a2c01c167d4>ba39660</denchmark-link>
I think the CMakeLists.txt is the default one without extra changes.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Leslie-Fang>@Leslie-Fang</denchmark-link> What's your system and compile command?

Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/VoVAllen>@VoVAllen</denchmark-link> for looking into this issue. The command I use is: <denchmark-code>mkdir build && cd build cmake .. && make -j4 </denchmark-code>
I am uning CentOS 7.6 with kernel 4.19
Still cannot reproduce your error. You could try pip install --pre dgl-cuXX to install our nightly build
I'm using cmake/3.7.2 and gcc/10.2.0 on CentOS 7. I rerun the whole thing a few times with git submodule update --init --recursive but the error still persists.
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hcho3>@hcho3</denchmark-link> , Could you take a look on this issue since the error seems from dmlc-core? Is there any gcc requirement on dmlc-core?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/VoVAllen>@VoVAllen</denchmark-link> GCC 5+ should be sufficient, to my knowledge. Let's see if I can reproduce the error in the CentOS 7 Docker image.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/yuanqing-wang>@yuanqing-wang</denchmark-link> Hi, Could you post your error message here?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/VoVAllen>@VoVAllen</denchmark-link> I posted it at the beginning of this thread. Is there anything else that I should post?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/yuanqing-wang>@yuanqing-wang</denchmark-link> But it's not gcc 10 right? Could you post the error log with gcc newer than gcc5?

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/VoVAllen>@VoVAllen</denchmark-link> I just made sure that my version is 10.2.0 and built again: <denchmark-code>Scanning dependencies of target dmlc Scanning dependencies of target metis [ 1%] Building CXX object third_party/dmlc-core/CMakeFiles/dmlc.dir/src/config.cc.o [ 1%] Building CXX object third_party/dmlc-core/CMakeFiles/dmlc.dir/src/data.cc.o [ 1%] Looks like I'm able to build this using gcc-7.1.0 but not gcc-10.2.0.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/yuanqing-wang>@yuanqing-wang</denchmark-link> Interesting, that's good to know. Can you tell us how you installed GCC 10 on CentOS 7?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/hcho3>@hcho3</denchmark-link> I'm using a LSF cluster and GCC was installed by the system admin but not myself.

I tried building CentOS 7 Docker container with GCC 9 as follows, and I could not reproduce the error. DGL builds successfully: FROM centos:7
RUN yum install -y centos-release-scl epel-release && yum install -y devtoolset-9 git ninja-build cmake3
ENV CC=/opt/rh/devtoolset-9/root/usr/bin/gcc ENV CXX=/opt/rh/devtoolset-9/root/usr/bin/c++ ENV CPP=/opt/rh/devtoolset-9/root/usr/bin/cpp Build commands: git clone --recursive https://github.com/dmlc/dgl.git cd dgl mkdir build cd build cmake3 .. -GNinja ninja

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/yuanqing-wang>@yuanqing-wang</denchmark-link> It seems your gcc is still 5. The warning is at <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dmlc/dmlc-core/blob/main/include/dmlc/base.h#L122>https://github.com/dmlc/dmlc-core/blob/main/include/dmlc/base.h#L122</denchmark-link> , which should only appear when your GCC<5
Hmmm in that case it must be things goin wrong on my end. So sorry about this.
